**Ice**, ., is a [dungeon feature](/wiki/Dungeon_feature "Dungeon feature") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

Ice may be formed formed when a [pool](/wiki/Pool "Pool") is frozen by a [spell](/wiki/Spellbook_of_cone_of_cold "Spellbook of cone of cold") or [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold"), a [frost horn](/wiki/Frost_horn "Frost horn"), or a [cold breath](/wiki/White_dragon "White dragon") [attack](/wiki/Winter_wolf "Winter wolf"), and is naturally found in a few places such as the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
  - [1.1 Melting](#Melting)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Messages](#Messages)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 Lethe patch](#Lethe_patch)
  - [5.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

- [6 See also](#See_also)

- [7 References](#References)

## Description

Ice is slippery, and walking on it often causes you to stumble, similar to one of the effects of [fumbling](/wiki/Fumbling "Fumbling"). When [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding") a non-flying steed over ice, there is a chance you may fall off your [saddle](/wiki/Saddle "Saddle"). [Corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") rot half as fast if laying on ice, and items on an icy floor will slide further when [kicked](/wiki/Kick "Kick").

Slipping on ice can be prevented by wearing [snow boots](/wiki/Snow_boots "Snow boots"), being a [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie"), or polymorphing into a monster with [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"). Cold resistance from any other source (e.g. eating a corpse, wearing the appropriate ring, or being a level 13 [Monk](/wiki/Monk "Monk")) will *not* prevent this fumbling. If snow boots are the random appearance of [fumble boots](/wiki/Fumble_boots "Fumble boots"), they still negate the fumbling effect of ice, but cause you to fumble by their own effect.

### Melting

Flames from a [fire](/wiki/Fire "Fire")-breathing monster, a [wand of fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire"), [fire traps](/wiki/Fire_traps "Fire traps"), and other sources of fire can melt ice and cause you to fall into the newly created [moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat"). Having [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") will guard against the rays, but will not prevent ice underfoot from melting. As with falling into normal water, your inventory will get [wet](/wiki/Wet "Wet"), and you will attempt to climb out, with a chance of drowning dependent on the circumstances.

Ice created by a spell or breath attack has a chance of melting on its own after between 50–2000 turns.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1) Ice created on level generation will always be permanent, and newly created ice has a chance of becoming permanent as well. Thawing ice that is hit with another spell or breath attack will increase the duration, and has another chance of becoming permanent. Players with [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") [will be informed](#Messages) if they are standing on ice that will break in under 15 turns.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Ice tiles appear in two [themed rooms](/wiki/Themed_room "Themed room"): an "ice room" where the entire floor is ice, and another room with a random terrain at the exact center, which can potentially be ice.

## Strategy

Creating ice is a common means of traversing water in areas such as [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island") and the [Castle](/wiki/Castle "Castle"). A source of [levitation](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation") or [water walking boots](/wiki/Water_walking_boots "Water walking boots") can help prevent drowning.

Melting ice is especially dangerous on the fire trap-laden Valkyrie quest, where an unwary [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") can trigger one and drown; in addition to the above, players can also stick to the narrow snow paths, such as the one leading to the [Norn](/wiki/Norn "Norn")'s dwelling. Additionally, if the Norn begins wandering around the ice (e.g., after you #[chat](/wiki/Chat "Chat") to her but before you qualify for entry to the quest), there is a minuscule possibility that she may step on one of the fire traps in the area and drown as a result. While this can be avoided by simply waiting until you are at experience level 14 before chatting to her, it is very unlikely for the Norn to die this way in the vast majority of games.

## History

Icy terrain first appears in [NetHack 3.1.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.0 "NetHack 3.1.0") with the introduction of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch and the [Valkyrie quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest"). Ice melting over time was introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0").

## Messages

- Whee! A(n) \<item> slides across the ice.

  You kicked an object resting on an icy floor.

- Some ice melts away.

  You saw an ice tile melt completely and revert to water.

- The ice seems very soft and slushy.

  You have warning and are standing on ice that will melt in under 15 turns.

- You feel the ice shift beneath you!

  As above, but in under 10 turns.

- The ice, is gonna BREAK!

  As above, but in under 5 turns; this is a direct quote from *[The Dead Zone](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Dead_Zone_\(film\) "wikipedia:The Dead Zone (film)")*, hence its punctuation.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), the [Ice Mage](/wiki/Ice_Mage "Ice Mage") [quest branch](/wiki/Ice_Mage_quest "Ice Mage quest") fittingly has icy plains on the home and upper filler levels.

### Lethe patch

In the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch") for vanilla *NetHack* and SLASH'EM, the lair of [Geryon](/wiki/Geryon "Geryon") found within [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom_\(Lethe_patch\) "Gehennom (Lethe patch)") is almost completely made of ice.

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), one of the [Big Room](/wiki/Big_Room "Big Room") maps and the goal level of the [Knight quest](/wiki/Knight_quest "Knight quest") contains several ice tiles, as does one of the [Lethe Gorge](/index.php?title=Lethe_Gorge_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Lethe Gorge (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") maps. Icy terrain also appears in the lairs of [Baalphegor](/wiki/Baalphegor "Baalphegor"), [Kostchtchie](/wiki/Kostchtchie "Kostchtchie") and the [creature in the ice](/wiki/Creature_in_the_ice "Creature in the ice") (which can be either [Leviathan](/wiki/Leviathan "Leviathan") or [Levistus](/index.php?title=Levistus\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Levistus (page does not exist)")).

## See also

- [Moat](/wiki/Moat "Moat")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 4363](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/zap.c#L4363)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/hack.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 2231](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/hack.c#L2231)
